<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 808, 92]]<|/det|>
The IGCSE class is determining the refractive index of the material of a transparent

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 468, 123]]<|/det|>
Fig. 5.1 shows a student's ray-trace sheet.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[131, 128, 821, 902]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[442, 917, 509, 934]]<|/det|>
<label>Fia. 5.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 803, 92]]<|/det|>
**ABCD** is a transparent block placed, largest face down, on the ray-trace sheet.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 103, 181, 121]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 102, 851, 152]]<|/det|>
On Fig. 5.1, draw a normal at the centre of side \(\mathbf{AB}\). Label the point \(\mathbf{E}\) where the normal crosses \(\mathbf{AB}\). Mark a point \(\mathbf{N}\) on the normal \(4.0 \text{cm}\) from \(\mathbf{E}\) and outside the outline of the block.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 135, 876, 153]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 164, 181, 183]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 163, 875, 214]]<|/det|>
Draw a line \(\mathbf{NF}\) from \(\mathbf{N}\) to the block. This line must be to the right of the normal and at an angle of \(20^{\circ}\) to the normal. Mark the point \(\mathbf{F}\) where the line meets \(\mathbf{AB}\). Measure and record the length \(a\) of the line \(\mathbf{NF}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[606, 227, 875, 245]]<|/det|>
<form>a = ......................................... [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 257, 146, 276]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 256, 875, 308]]<|/det|>
The student places two pins \(\mathsf{P}_{1}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{2}\) on the line through \(\mathbf{F}\) and \(\mathbf{N}\). She observes the images of \(\mathsf{P}_{1}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{2}\) through side \(\mathbf{C}\mathbf{D}\) of the block so that the images of \(\mathsf{P}_{1}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{2}\) appear one behind the other.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 319, 875, 370]]<|/det|>
She places two pins \(\mathsf{P}_{3}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{4}\) between her eye and the block so that \(\mathsf{P}_{3}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{4}\) and the images of \(\mathsf{P}_{1}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{2}\), seen through the block, appear one behind the other. The positions of \(\mathsf{P}_{3}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{4}\) are marked on Fig. 5.1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 382, 180, 401]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 381, 875, 415]]<|/det|>
